verses.roman:
uvāsa katicin māsān
rājño vṛtta-vivitsayā
duṣprajasyālpa-sārasya
khala-cchandānuvartinaḥ

synonyms: uvāsa—resided; katicit—some; māsān—months; rājñaḥ—of the King (Dhṛtarāṣṭra); vṛtta—the activity; vivitsayā—with the desire of finding out; duṣprajasya—whose sons were wicked; alpa—weak; sārasya—whose determination; khala—of mischievous persons (like Karṇa); chanda—the desires; anuvartinaḥ—who tended to follow.
translation: He remained in Hastināpura for several months to scrutinize the conduct of the weak-willed King, who had bad sons and who was inclined to give in to the whims of mischievous advisers.
